Activity: Arrive at the office, grab a coffee, and quickly scan emails. Check if there's anything urgent from @COO-1 or @CIO-1 regarding the fund's launch preparations.

Review the four main goals for the week: finalize the accounting framework, establish tracking procedures, prepare for the first audit, and coordinate with the external auditor. Mentally prioritize them based on urgency and dependencies. Audit prep and framework finalization seem most pressing.

Start working on finalizing the accounting and reporting framework. Review the existing draft, focusing on areas related to statistical arbitrage funds, especially regarding valuation of complex positions and treatment of transaction costs.  Cross-reference with industry best practices and relevant accounting standards (e.g., ASC 820).
Take a quick break. Browse financial news websites like Bloomberg or the Wall Street Journal for market updates and any relevant regulatory changes that might impact the fund's accounting.

Identify gaps or ambiguities in the current accounting framework draft.  Draft an email to @LEGAL-1 to clarify the legal interpretation of certain SEC regulations related to fund valuation. Also, include @COMP-1 in the email for compliance oversight.
Lunch break. Head out to grab a bite with some colleagues to recharge.
Resume work on the accounting framework, incorporating any insights from the morning's research and the email sent to @LEGAL-1 and @COMP-1.  Focus on the section related to expense allocation.

Shift focus to establishing procedures for tracking fund performance. Review the existing performance calculation methodologies proposed by the quantitative research team @QRES-1, @QRES-2, @QRES-3. Ensure they align with accounting standards and can be accurately reflected in the fund's financial statements.
Document the performance tracking procedures, including data sources, calculation formulas, and reporting frequency.  Draft a preliminary version of the performance tracking report template.
Wrap up for the day. Make a to-do list for tomorrow based on today's progress. Ensure all documents are saved and backed up.
